com.fortify.pub.issueparsing

Interface IssueHandler


  • public interface IssueHandler
    A generic interface that should be implemented to store issue attributes. Parsers typically take in a file or input stream, and an IssueHandler. They parse the file / input stream in a certain way to extract the issue information, but then they call into the IssueHandler to actually store the issue information.

    • Method Detail

      • startIssue

        UpdateStatus startIssue(java.lang.String uniqueIssueIdentifier)
        Start parsing a new issue. All subsequent calls to set attributes will apply to this issue. To start a new issue, you should first call endIssue(String), and then call this method again.
        Parameters:
        uniqueIssueIdentifier - the instance id for the issue
        Returns:
        the issue's status (new, updated, removed, etc.)

      • endIssue

        void endIssue(java.lang.String issueInstanceID)
        Stop parsing a particular issue. startIssue(String) should then be called to start parsing another issue. This method may do some post-processing on the issue as well.
        Parameters:
        issueInstanceID - the issue's instance id

      • setProduct

        void setProduct(java.lang.String product)
        Set the product, or analysis type, for the issue. For instance, "WEBINSPECT"
        Parameters:
        product - the product, or analysis type, for the issue. For instance, "WEBINSPECT"

      • setCategorySourceType

        void setCategorySourceType(java.lang.String categorySourceType)
        Set source type of the category. See CategorySourceType values for details. Only string representations of the CategorySourceType items can be passed to this function.
        Parameters:
        categorySourceType - type of the category source type.

      • setPackageName

        void setPackageName(java.lang.String packageName)
        Set the package, or namespace, of the issue. In Java, this should correspond to the directory structure of the file.
        Parameters:
        packageName - the package, or namespace, of the issue

      • setPrimaryRuleID

        void setPrimaryRuleID(java.lang.String ruleID)
        The unique id for the rule that found this issue. This rule id is used to match up things like metainfo attributes (accuracy, impact, etc.)
        Parameters:
        ruleID - the unique id for the rule that found this issue

      • setCategoryTypeAndSubType

        void setCategoryTypeAndSubType(java.lang.String vulnType,
                               java.lang.String vulnSubType)
        Categories consist of a required type and an optional subtype.
        Parameters:
        vulnType - the category type, required
        vulnSubType - the the category subtype, if it exists, or null if there is not subtype

      • setCategoryTypeAndSubType

        void setCategoryTypeAndSubType(ParsedVulnerability parsedVulnType)
        Categories consist of a required type and an optional subtype.
        Parameters:
        parsedVulnType - object contained type and sub type of the vulnerability, required

      • setKingdom

        void setKingdom(java.lang.String kingdom)
        Set the kingdom of the issue, which is typically one step higher than category
        Parameters:
        kingdom - the kingdom for the issue

      • setAnalyzerName

        void setAnalyzerName(java.lang.String analyzerName)
        Sets the name of the analyzer that found this issue. For pentest issues, this should be "pentest"
        Parameters:
        analyzerName - the name of the analyzer that found this issue

      • setIssueSpecificDescription

        void setIssueSpecificDescription(java.lang.String description)
        Sets the description for the issue
        Parameters:
        description - the new description for the issue

      • setSeverity

        void setSeverity(float severity)
        Sets the severity of the issue.
        Parameters:
        severity - the severity of the issue, which should range from 1.0 to 5.0

      • setConfidence

        void setConfidence(float confidence)
        Sets the confidence of the issue, which is actually the confidence of the analyzer in the issue.
        Parameters:
        confidence - the confidence of the analyzer in the issue, which should range from 1.0 to 5.0

      • setMinVirtualCallConfidence

        void setMinVirtualCallConfidence(float minVirtualCallConfidence)
        Sets the minimum virtual call confidence of all nodes in the best trace path.
        Parameters:
        minVirtualCallConfidence - the minimum virtual call confidence, which should range from 0.0 to 1.0

      • setClassName

        void setClassName(java.lang.String classname)
        Set the classname of the issue. For Java, this should match the short filename where the issue was found.
        Parameters:
        classname - the issue's class name

      • setFunctionName

        void setFunctionName(java.lang.String functionName)
        Set the function name of the issue.
        Parameters:
        functionName - the issue's function name

        The file name of the sink node
        Parameters:

        The URL of the issue
        Parameters:

        Sets the source attribute of the issue
        Parameters:
        source - the new source value

      • setSourceFile

        void setSourceFile(java.lang.String sourceFile)
        The file name of the source node
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - the file name of the source node

        The line number of the source node
        Parameters:

      • setSink

        void setSink(java.lang.String sink)
        Sets the sink attribute of the issue
        Parameters:
        sink - the new sink value

      • setRemediationConstant

        void setRemediationConstant(float remdiationConstant)
        Set the remediation effort of the issue. Major remediation issues must be addressed in multiple locations to fix the underlying defect. Minor remediation issues may be addressed at the line of the underlying defect.
        Parameters:
        remdiationConstant - the remediation effort, which hould range from 1.0 to 5.0

      • setImpact

        void setImpact(float impact)
        Set the impact of the issue, which is the potential damage an attacker could do by successfully exploiting a vulnerability
        Parameters:
        impact - the potential damage an attacker could do by successfully exploiting a vulnerability. Should range from 1.0 to 5.0

      • setLikelihood

        void setLikelihood(float likelihood)
        Set the likelihood of the issue, which is the probability that a vulnerability will be accurately identified and successfully exploited.

        Likelihood is typically calculated as (probability * accuracy * confidence) / 25
        Parameters:
        likelihood - the probability that a vulnerability will be accurately identified and successfully exploited. Should range from 1.0 to 5.0

      • setProbability

        void setProbability(float probability)
        Sets the probability of the issue, which is the probability that the issue, if identified correctly, can be exploited.
        Parameters:
        probability - the new probability value, which is the probability that the issue, if identified correctly, can be exploited.

      • setAccuracy

        void setAccuracy(float acc)
        Set the accuracy of the issue, which is typically the accuracy of the rule that detected the issue.
        Parameters:
        acc - the new accuracy value, which is typically the accuracy of the rule that detected the issue.

      • setPriority

        void setPriority(PriorityValues priority)
        Set the Fortify Priority Order for the issue. See PriorityValues for a description of each value. Priority is typically calculated as:

        High = value >= 2.5 Low = value < 2.5

        Critical = High Impact and High Likelihood Hot = High Impact and Low Likelihood Medium = Low Impact and High Likelihood Low = Low Impact and Low Likelihood
        Parameters:
        priority - the new priority value

      • setPrimaryRequest

        void setPrimaryRequest(Request request)
        Set the primary request object. If an issue has multiple requests, the others should be set with setSecondaryRequests(java.util.List)
        Parameters:
        request - the primary request object

      • setSecondaryRequests

        void setSecondaryRequests(java.util.List<? extends Request> secondaryRequests)
        Set the secondary request objects. This should only be called when an issue has multiple requests (in which case the primary request be set with setPrimaryRequest(Request))
        Parameters:
        secondaryRequests - the secondary request objects

      • setManual

        void setManual(java.lang.Boolean manual)
        Set Manual attribute value for handled issue.
        Parameters:
        manual -
